Uses of Class
simplenlg.framework.LexicalCategory

  • Packages that use LexicalCategory 
    Package Description
    simplenlg.framework
    The framework package contains the base components required for running the SimpleNLG package.
    simplenlg.lexicon  

    • Uses of LexicalCategory in simplenlg.framework

      Methods in simplenlg.framework that return LexicalCategory 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static LexicalCategory LexicalCategory.valueOf(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static LexicalCategory[] LexicalCategory.values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
      Methods in simplenlg.framework with parameters of type LexicalCategory 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      NLGElement NLGFactory.createInflectedWord(java.lang.Object word, LexicalCategory category)
      Create an inflected word element.
      NLGElement NLGFactory.createNLGElement(java.lang.Object element, LexicalCategory category)
      this method creates an NLGElement from an object If object is null, return null If the object is already an NLGElement, it is returned unchanged Exception: if it is an InflectedWordElement, return underlying WordElement If it is a String which matches a lexicon entry or pronoun, the relevant WordElement is returned If it is a different String, a wordElement is created if the string is a single word Otherwise a StringElement is returned Otherwise throw an exception
      NLGElement NLGFactory.createWord(java.lang.Object word, LexicalCategory category)
      Creates a new element representing a word.
      Constructors in simplenlg.framework with parameters of type LexicalCategory 
      Constructor and Description
      InflectedWordElement(java.lang.String word, LexicalCategory category)
      Constructs a new inflected word using the giving word as the base form.
      WordElement(java.lang.String baseForm, LexicalCategory category)
      create a WordElement with the specified baseForm and category
      WordElement(java.lang.String baseForm, LexicalCategory category, java.lang.String id)
      create a WordElement with the specified baseForm, category, ID

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      WordElement Lexicon.getWord(java.lang.String baseForm, LexicalCategory category)
      get a WordElement which has the specified base form and category
      WordElement Lexicon.getWordFromVariant(java.lang.String variant, LexicalCategory category)
      returns a WordElement which has the specified inflected form and/or spelling variant that matches the specified variant, of the specified category
      java.util.List<WordElement> XMLLexicon.getWords(java.lang.String baseForm, LexicalCategory category) 
      java.util.List<WordElement> NIHDBLexicon.getWords(java.lang.String baseForm, LexicalCategory category)

      abstract java.util.List<WordElement> Lexicon.getWords(java.lang.String baseForm, LexicalCategory category)
      returns all Words which have the specified base form and category
      java.util.List<WordElement> XMLLexicon.getWordsFromVariant(java.lang.String variant, LexicalCategory category) 
      java.util.List<WordElement> NIHDBLexicon.getWordsFromVariant(java.lang.String variant, LexicalCategory category) 
      java.util.List<WordElement> MultipleLexicon.getWordsFromVariant(java.lang.String variant, LexicalCategory category) 
      abstract java.util.List<WordElement> Lexicon.getWordsFromVariant(java.lang.String variant, LexicalCategory category)
      returns Words which have an inflected form and/or spelling variant that matches the specified variant, and are in the specified category.
      boolean Lexicon.hasWord(java.lang.String baseForm, LexicalCategory category)
      return true if the lexicon contains a WordElement which has the specified base form and category
      boolean Lexicon.hasWordFromVariant(java.lang.String variant, LexicalCategory category)
      return true if the lexicon contains a WordElement which matches the specified variant form and category
      WordElement Lexicon.lookupWord(java.lang.String baseForm, LexicalCategory category)
      General word lookup method, tries base form, variant, ID (in this order) Creates new word if can't find existing word
